Авторы: Zeedijk H.
Название: Future air pollution due to sulphur dioxide (Dutch)
Авторы организаций: Zeedijk, H.
Краткое описание: An overview is presented of the future energy policy in The Netherlands, as outlined in the Energy Report. Proceeding from the policy plan 'variant 9', an estimate is made of SO2 air pollution resulting from the combustion of coal and oil. It appears from this that after an initial continuation of the trend of falling SO2 emissions of recent years, we may expect a noticeable increase in such air polution after 1976. This is the result of changeovers on the part of the large fossil fuel burners to the use of oil instead of natural gas.
Ключевые слова указателя: coal; oil; sulfur dioxide; air pollution; methodology

Авторы: Ferguson P.A.
Название: Hydrogen sulfide removal from gases, air, and liquids
Авторы организаций: Ferguson, P.A.
Краткое описание: Large quantities of hydrogen sulfide are produced as a byproduct in the purification of natural gas, petroleum and in coal coking operations. Hydrogen sulfide is usually removed from the sour gas by absorption in an alkaline solution. The absorbed H2S is removed from the solution by heating it and stripping with a gas. The resultant concentrated H2S gas stream is then typically sent to a modified Claus process facility for conversion to sulfur. The tail gas from the stack containing the unconverted H2S is then typically burned, converting the H2S into SO2 and releasing it to the atmosphere. Sulfur emissions in the form of SO2 or H2S that were acceptable in the past are no longer permitted as various governmental pollution control agencies adopt more stringent standards. This pollution control problem also applies to numerous industrial operations in which H2S is a byproduct. The purpose of this book is to furnish reliable and efficient methods of H2S removal from sour gases, air and liquids. The major gas purification processes based on alkali metal carbonates, additional inorganic compounds, alkanolamines and other organic compounds, oxidation and other processes are described. Also considered are processes for pulp mill liquor recovery and odor abatement, as well as methods of H2S removal from aqueous solutions and other liquids, such as benzene, liquid hydrocarbons, and glycolic and alcoholic compounds.
Ключевые слова указателя: hydrogen sulfide; therapy; waste management

Авторы: Treshow M.
Название: Biological consequences of environmental control
Организации: Biol. Dept., Univ. Utah, Salt Lake City, Ut. 84112, United States
Авторы организаций: Treshow, M., Biol. Dept., Univ. Utah, Salt Lake City, Ut. 84112, United States
Краткое описание: This paper explores the possible secondary biologic consequences of successful implementation of environmental control programs. Several examples are given of pollution control programs that initially seemed beneficial but later proved otherwise, such as the use of DDT for the control of insect pests; the mandatory conversion of many coal fired power generating facilities to natural gas or oil, and the subsequent reconversion back to coal and the necessary emission control equipment after the realization of the need to conserve these fuel reserves. Also considered is the manner in which tall stacks managed to reduce the ground level concentrations nearest the stack, but increased concentrations further away where emissions had not previously reached with short stacks. Some possible effects on ecosystems are also discussed, with attention to natural ozone tolerances of plants that have evolved in the presence of ozone and the unavoidable affects of natural pollution sources. The probable costs of implementation of stricter pollution control standards are compared to the possible limited benefits that may be gained.
Ключевые слова указателя: ozone; ozone; air pollution; environmental health; industry; intoxication; methodology; prevention; air pollutant; air pollution; article; ecology; environmental health; industrial waste; photochemistry; plant; pollution; United Kingdom; United States; Air Pollutants, Environmental; Air Pollution; Ecology; Environmental Health; Environmental Pollution; Industrial Waste; Legislation; London; Ozone; Photochemistry; Plants; United States

Авторы: Zabel J.B.
Название: The automobile now and in the future and problems of energy, materials and environment (Dutch)
Организации: Econ. Techn. Afd., Cent. Organ. TNO, Den Haag, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Zabel, J.B., Econ. Techn. Afd., Cent. Organ. TNO, Den Haag, Netherlands
Краткое описание: Alternative types of fuels, such as liquid petroleum gas (LPG), synthetic natural gas (SNG), methanol and hydrogen, are compared in terms of economy, power and emission levels, and attention is given to the respective advantages of the Otto and diesel engines over the conventional internal combustion engines. Also considered is the possibility of substituting some of the metals traditionally used in automobile manufacture with aluminum, and it is noted that by 1985 savings in weight can be achieved for as much as 531 kg in small automobiles. It is speculated that the Otto and diesel will continue to grow in popularity and, with regard to the alternative fuels, methanol appears to have a good chance of gaining wider acceptance in the GFR. The use of liquid hydrogen for automobile fuel is considered doubtful due to its limitations on account of supply, storage and distribution difficulties. The manufacture of synthetic liquid hydrocarbons from coal is expected to increase in importance as an alternative fuel source.
Ключевые слова указателя: fuel; diesel engine; energy conservation; internal combustion engine; otto engine; prevention

Авторы: Pavoni J.L., Heer Jr. J.E., Hagerty D.J.
Название: Handbook of solid waste disposal. Materials and energy recovery
Организации: TenEch Environm. Consultants Inc., Louisville, Ky., United States
Авторы организаций: Pavoni, J.L., TenEch Environm. Consultants Inc., Louisville, Ky., United States; Heer Jr., J.E., TenEch Environm. Consultants Inc., Louisville, Ky., United States; Hagerty, D.J., TenEch Environm. Consultants Inc., Louisville, Ky., United States
Краткое описание: This handbook provides an in depth analysis of both traditional and innovative solid waste disposal techniques, as well as of new developments in materials and energy recovery systems. Each method is evaluated with an analysis of system methodology; controlling process parameters; and process requirements, byproducts, economics and case histories. All of the new systems developed over the past few years are described and evaluated, including medium and high temperature incineration, wet pulping, landfill lith leachate recirculation, the Hercules, Inc. system, U.S. Bureau of Mines front end and back end systems, pyrolysis, waste heat utilization, the Combustion Power Unit 400, use of refuse as a supplementary fuel, and methane production from anaerobic fermentation. The traditional systems of sanitary landfilling, incineration and composting are also thoroughly examined. To aid in exploiting the potential of recycling, the authors provide descriptions of techniques used in materials recovery systems, such as direct recycling, recycling from mixed refuse, and the recently developed materials separation system for use on mixed municipal wastes. New methods for exploiting energy found in solid wastes are also discussed. These include use of waste as supplementary fuel with coal in the generation of electricity, as a heat source in the production of steam, as a direct source of power for the generation of electricity, and as a natural gas source. Guidelines for selecting both short and long term refuse management systems are outlined, and European solid waste management techniques are evaluated for their applicability to the US. Economic, operational and technical data are presented for the European operations for power production through waste heat utilization; composting with front end and back end separation; land filling to provide recreation areas; transfer station operation; and animal food production and paper pulp recovery from solid wastes.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Sackett W.M., Brooks J.M.
Название: Origin and distributions of low molecular weight hydrocarbons in Gulf of Mexico coastal waters
Организации: Dept. Oceanography, Texas A&M Univ., College Station, Tex. 77843, United States
Авторы организаций: Sackett, W.M., Dept. Oceanography, Texas A&M Univ., College Station, Tex. 77843, United States; Brooks, J.M., Dept. Oceanography, Texas A&M Univ., College Station, Tex. 77843, United States
Краткое описание: Thousands of C1 to C5 dissolved hydrocarbon determinations have been made on water samples from the Gulf of Mexico in order to locate and/or characterize (1) natural seeps and (2) man derived sources of petroleum contamination. Rising bubbles from over 100 natural gas seeps have been located by various groups using conventional sonar techniques, but the only bubbles analyzed thus far have hydrocarbon (>99% CH4) and isotopic (δ13C(CH4) -60°/oo vs PBD) compositions, indicative of a biological rather than a petroleum origin. Extremely high dissolved hydrocarbon concentrations were found in areas receiving effluents from petroleum production, transportation and refining operations. Two oil industry practices are especially important from a pollution point of view; the underwater venting of non commercial amounts of gases issuing from gas/liquid separators and the discharging of brines with high concentrations of the relatively water soluble components of petroleum. The hydrocarbon inputs into coastal waters along the Gulf coast due to natural seeps are apparently negligible compared to man derived inputs. Loss to the atmosphere is the primary fate of dissolved hydrocarbons in coastal waters.
Ключевые слова указателя: hydrocarbon; coastal waters; methodology

Авторы: [автор не найден]
Название: Release of SO2 is down but...
Краткое описание: Sulfurous gas remains the major air pollutant in Canada, posing a different problem for processors according to their industry. Woodpulpers and natural gas processors are well into programs by which they expect to reduce emissions of SO2 to established standards, and other processors, most of them not equipped to treat flue gases, are trying to meet regulations by adjusting the level of their operations or by building tall stacks. Treatment methods for the removal of SO2 from emissions are reviewed with regard to the natural gas processing, woodpulping, metal smelting and electrical power industries in Canada. Consideration is also given to the extra cost these treatment measures entail and possibilities of recovering some portion of SO2 removal investments by commercial use of H2SO4.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Lewerissa R.J.
Название: Marine transport of LNG, LPG and ammonia. II (Dutch)
Организации: Grasso, Den Bosch, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Lewerissa, R.J., Grasso, Den Bosch, Netherlands
Краткое описание: The main features, advantages and disadvantages of the 4 methods for marine transport of liquid natural gas (LNG), liquid petroleum gas (LPG) and liquid ammonia are described. These methods comprise transportation of the liquid gas completely under pressure, completely cooled at atmospheric pressure, half cooled at a pressure above the atmospheric pressure, or with a combination of full pressure and complete cooling. The author also describes the 2 tank types for the cooled transport of liquid gas, sulf supporting tanks and membrane tanks, and roughly indicates the costs of LNG marine transport. Finally, general conclusions are drawn with regard to the present state and the future developments in the world marine transport of liquid gas.

Авторы: Gesell T.F.
Название: Occupational radiation exposure due to222Rn in natural gas and natural gas products
Организации: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston, School of Public Health, P.O. Box 20186, Houston, TX, 77025, United States
Авторы организаций: Gesell, T.F., The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston, School of Public Health, P.O. Box 20186, Houston, TX, 77025, United States
Краткое описание: The potential hazard of occupational exposure to the radiations of222Rn and its daughters in the natural gas industry is examined. The results of a study of222Rn concentrations and external radiation fields in nine geographically diverse natural gas processing plants are given, and the results are interpreted in terms of occupational exposure. It is concluded that while both internal and external exposures to the radiations from222Rn and its short-lived daughters do occur, the magnitudes of the exposures are not serious. The potential problem of exposure during maintenance operations to long-lived222Rn daughters which may build up on the interior surfaces of gas processing equipment is recognized but not resolved. © 1975 Health Physics Society.

Авторы: Sigal I.J., Gurevic N.A., Machorin K.E., Ilcenko A.I.
Название: Study of nitrogen emission during combustion of fuel in the flame and in the whirlpool [UNTERSUCHUNG DER STICKOXIDEMISSION BEI DER VERFEUERUNG DES BRENNSTOFFES IN DER FLAMME UND IM WIRBELBETT]
Организации: Inst. Gasforsch., Ukrain. Akad. Wissensch., Kiev
Авторы организаций: Sigal, I.J., Inst. Gasforsch., Ukrain. Akad. Wissensch., Kiev; Gurevic, N.A., Inst. Gasforsch., Ukrain. Akad. Wissensch., Kiev; Machorin, K.E., Inst. Gasforsch., Ukrain. Akad. Wissensch., Kiev; Ilcenko, A.I., Inst. Gasforsch., Ukrain. Akad. Wissensch., Kiev
Краткое описание: This article reports a study of NO emissions during combustion of different fuel mixtures and temperatures and for both direct combustion in the flame and for whirlpool combustion. After discussing current techniques used to lower SO2 and NO emissions (recirculation, 2 phase combustion) the author describes the equipment used: natural gas injected through 14 injectors (40 mm diameter) in a combustion chamber with a 330 mm diameter and 800 mm height. The methods used to assess optimal fuel mixture and temperature for low NO emission combustion are outlined. NO emissions were measured using the linear coloristic method. The results obtained favor the use of whirlpool combustion installations.

Авторы: [автор не найден]
Название: The energy problem. Changeover from natural gas to oil means increased air pollution (Dutch)
Краткое описание: In the Netherlands, energy use has increased by more than 8% in recent years. This increase is too great according to the government, both for general reasons of energy conservation and because it will eventually mean, if unchecked, that the Netherlands will become more and more dependent on imports of oil. The proportion of the national energy provided by oil is expected to rise by 1985 to 73%. The government has stated its intention to introduce energy conserving regulations. One of these is the reduction in the amount of natural gas used (saving the rest for a possible future oil boycott); this will have direct consequences for the Rhine delta area. Plans for the area include construction of a nuclear power plant; however, some authorities feel that in light of the high concentration of population and industry in the area, the risk is too great. Use of oil instead of natural gas in a number of power plants in the Rijnmond area will significantly worsen the air pollution situation there, cancelling a decade's worth of progress in cleaning up the atmosphere.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Kato S.
Название: Tasks for clean energy and sunshine projects
Авторы организаций: Kato, S.
Краткое описание: Nuclear energy, solar energy, synthetic natural gas, geothermal energy, oceanic energy, and meteorological energy are among the new sources of energy that can be harnessed to meet the growing energy demand. Of course nuclear energy is considered the mainstay energy source that is expected to play a vital role in overall energy consumption. Solar energy, synthetic natural gas and geothermal energy are also considered promising. Hydrogen is a promising secondary energy that can be used in lieu of existing fossil fuels. Whether these energy sources can be actually tapped depends on progress in technological development. It is therefore necessary to provide a certain period of lead time so that the volume of energy required at a given time may be supplied, i.e., specific dates should be set as they were in the Apollo Project of the U.S. Such an approach is taken in the Sunshine Project now being promoted in Japan. The project was launched in 1974 for the purpose of developing, before 2000, an assortment of new techniques for tapping clean energy sources that remain untapped, including solar energy. This article outlines the overall planning goals for this project. Techniques to be developed include those relating to solar energy, geothermal energy, coal gasification and liquefaction, and hydrogen. These are given priority in the initial stage of the project. As for other techniques, work is to be initiated as required, and includes feasibility studies. At the present stage of the Sunshine Project it is necessary to set the direction of research and development on the basis of current technological forecasts and to incorporate a function that will make it possible, if need be, to make basic changes in the direction thus delineated. A number of tools are available for this purpose. These include, for example, a total energy system, technology assessment, and scientific research management. The research work on the total energy system is designed to study how new energy techniques involving solar energy, geothermal energy, coal gasification and liquefaction, and hydrogen energy are positioned in the energy supply system, and how these techniques are interrelated. More specifically, items of study include long term prospects for energy supplies, interactions between diverse supply factors and consumption patterns, and effects of the new energy techniques on both supply and consumption. These items will be evaluated in terms of supply stability and reliability, availability, costs and natural and social effects. Various models are to be developed for the analysis of these factors.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Volesky B., Zajic J.E., Carroll K.K.
Название: Feeding studies in rats with high protein fungus grown on natural gas
Организации: Biochem. Engin., Univ. West. Ontario, London, Canada
Авторы организаций: Volesky, B., Biochem. Engin., Univ. West. Ontario, London, Canada; Zajic, J.E., Biochem. Engin., Univ. West. Ontario, London, Canada; Carroll, K.K., Biochem. Engin., Univ. West. Ontario, London, Canada
Краткое описание: Preliminary feeding studies were conducted with a high protein fungus (Graphium sp.) grown on natural gas. The biomass, containing approximately 50% protein, is considered a potential source of single cell protein. In short term (1 wk) experiments, rats gained weight when fed semisynthetic diets containing up to 40% of the biomass, although growth was depressed at the higher levels. Rats lost weight but survived for this length of time when fed biomass alone. Chronic toxicity was tested in a 5 mth study with diets in which the casein (20% by weight) of the semisynthetic diet was either partially or entirely replaced by the proteinaceous biomass. Rats fed these diets grew more slowly but appeared normal and healthy, and no pathologic changes were observed at autopsy. Some of these rats were fed a standard laboratory diet for an additional 10 mth observation period, and at autopsy, one cortical adenoma of the kidney was found in a rat originally fed the lower level of Graphium biomass.
Ключевые слова указателя: protein; feeding behavior; fungus; growth; rat; theoretical study

Авторы: Gesell T.F., Prighard H.M.
Название: The technologically enhanced natural radiation environment
Организации: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston School of Public Health, P.O. Box 20186, Houston, TX, 77025, United States
Авторы организаций: Gesell, T.F., The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston School of Public Health, P.O. Box 20186, Houston, TX, 77025, United States; Prighard, H.M., The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston School of Public Health, P.O. Box 20186, Houston, TX, 77025, United States
Краткое описание: A new category for human radiation exposure, technologically enhanced natural radiation (TENR), is proposed. The purpose of the new category is to permit clear distinction between truly natural human radiation exposure and exposure which occurs due to alteration of the natural sources by non-nuclear technology. Examples of TENR, such as radium emission from coal fired plants, radon in natural gas, radium in fertilizer, radon in water and enhanced cosmic ray exposure in high altitude aircraft are discussed. It is concluded that creation of the TENR category would be useful because (1) it would facilitate direct comparison of increments to the radiation environment due to nuclear and conventional activities, (2) it would direct research to TENR which would perhaps uncover significant human exposure and (3) it would permit regulatory authorities to control unambiguously TENR exposures without having to decide in each instance whether the exposure was natural or man-made. © 1975 Health Physics Society.

Авторы: Bron Ya. V., Veletskii R.K., Levin G.G.
Название: Equipment for after burning CO and removing dust from cupola waste gases
Авторы организаций: Bron Ya., V.; Veletskii, R.K.; Levin, G.G.
Краткое описание: An afterburning and cleaning system at a foundry is described, consisting of an afterburning unit and a wet dust catcher operating on natural draught. Three injection burners consume 15 to 17 m3/hr each of natural gas at 0.5 to 0.8 atm to burn the carbon monoxide. Tests were carried out to determine the gas volumes over the cupola burden and entering the wet dust catcher, the gas temperatures after burning and scrubbing, the gas compositions over the burden and after burning and the dust contents before and after scrubbing. The volume of the gases at the burden averaged 16,000 m3/hr increasing to 30 to 32,000 m3/hr after dilution. The CO content of the gases at the burden surface ranged from 6 to 21%. The dust content of the cupola gases was 1.5 to 5.5 g/m3, and the gas temperature varied between 100 and 350°C. At initial CO concentrations exceeding the lower limit of ignition, afterburning was substantially complete, leaving residual CO concentrations of 0.2 to 0.6%. There is a sufficient CO concentration at the burners to support combustion over almost the entire melting period. The dust catching system functions consistently. The pollution levels found outside the foundry were within the permitted limits.
Ключевые слова указателя: carbon monoxide; dust; gas waste; incineration; therapy

Авторы: Van Der Kooij J., Elshout A.J.
Название: Measurements of nitrogen oxides in Dutch power stations [NO(x) MESSUNGEN IN DEN NIEDERLANDISCHEN KRAFTWERKEN]
Организации: N.V. KEMA, Arnhem, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Van Der Kooij, J., N.V. KEMA, Arnhem, Netherlands; Elshout, A.J., N.V. KEMA, Arnhem, Netherlands
Краткое описание: The results of investigations are discussed concerning the emissions of nitrogen oxides from Dutch power stations. A general view of the emission in The Netherlands was made with the help of the collected data. In spite of the increasing total fuel consumption, the marked changes in the fuel type used in The Netherlands resulted, as far as the NOX emission calculated as NO2 is concerned, in a relatively constant emission of approximately 60,000 tons/yr in the years 1968 to 1973. It became clear that the relative NOX emission factors obtained during the examinations are not generally applicable. A comparison with a similar American investigation showed, for instance, that on an average the NOX emission of the natural gas fired boilers operated in The Netherlands is clearly smaller. This is caused by differences in furnace thermal load, in calorific value of the natural gas, and in the excess air. The various factors influencing the formation of NOX in furnaces are discussed on the basis of the results obtained. In particular the formation of fuel NOX in oil and coal fired boilers is illustrated with examples. Finally, the running investigations into the reduction NOX emissions are dealt with. It proved to be possible to decrease the NOX emissions of gas fired boilers considerably by using the staged firing method.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health; BOILER FIRING - Gas; POWER PLANTS - Boilers; AIR POLLUTION

Авторы: Doelman J., Elshout A.J., Guicherit R., Van Der Kooij J.
Название: Air pollution by nitrogen oxides in The Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Doelman, J.; Elshout, A.J.; Guicherit, R.; Van Der Kooij, J.
Краткое описание: At the end of the 1960's, various Dutch organizations began studies on the effects of nitrogen oxides. This paper reports on the results of 3 of these studies. A description is presented of the work carried out on measurements of ground level concentrations of nitrogen oxides and related products. A tendency to higher ozone concentrations has been noted in The Netherlands, but these increased ozone concentrations during smog periods occurred simultaneously in large areas and cannot directly be related to the emissions of large industrialized and urbanized areas in the country. A second paper deals with field measurements of the nitrogen oxide emissions of mainly industrial installations firing Groningen natural gas. Contrary to what had originally been expected, the gas fired installations proved to emit rather low amounts of nitrogen oxides. It was found that for gas fired installations, varying from hot water heaters in domestic use to industrial installations with a heat input up to 100 MW, the emissions were rather constant, amounting to about 50 g nitrogen oxides (calculated as NO2) per 109 Joule. Larger installations can produce considerably higher quantities of nitrogen oxides. An emission inventory based on the available data is given for The Netherlands. In the last part, the influence of the main parameters of large boilers on nitrogen oxide formation is discussed and the possibilities of decreasing nitrogen oxide emissions from gas fired large boilers are described.
Ключевые слова указателя: natural gas; nitrogen oxide; ozone; industrial air pollution; methodology; air pollution; environmental health; theoretical study

Авторы: Levitt M.D.
Название: Methane Production in the Gut
Организации: University of Minnesota Minneapolis, Minn. 55455, United States
Авторы организаций: Levitt, M.D., University of Minnesota Minneapolis, Minn. 55455, United States
Краткое описание: Although gas production in the human intestinal tract has long been a topic of considerable interest to the lay public, this subject has received little scientific attention. Much of what is known about bacterial gas production in the gut has resulted from veterinary studies. This disproportionate attention to the “gas” of animals is motivated not by concern for their flatulent discomfort but rather for the financial implications of gas production in ruminants. Methane, the primary constituent of natural gas, is liberated in the rumen by strictly anerobic organisms via a reaction in which carbon dioxide is reduced to methane by. © 1974, Massachusetts Medical Society. Краткое описание: In spite of the change from coal gas to the allegedly innocuous natural gas, 12 fatal cases of poisoning while taking a bath, happened in the Duesseldorf area in 1968. Death was due to carbon monoxide poisoning caused by incomplete combustion of natural gas in poorly maintained burners and insufficient ventilation of the combustion products. It is frankly irresponsible to emphasize that natural gas is non-toxic when it is used in old heating systems which were not changed to newly required standards. Proper controls and regular maintenance should therefore be made mandatory. © 1974 Springer-Verlag.

Название: Energy for Europe: research and development (Dutch)
Краткое описание: This bulletin of the European Communities includes an outline of a research and development program, 'Energy for Europe', of the European Commission, which is to be followed by detailed proposals before the end of 1974. The program is meant to integrate all research and development work carried out by the European Community or its member countries into a coherent strategy corresponding with the aims of a common energy policy by means of coordination of national activities and planning of common actions. The Commission has established 8 fields of priority this program must include, namely the making of an inventory of the research and development work in the field of energy in the member countries, economical use of energy, fossil energy (including improvement of coal mining, conversion of coal into hydrocarbons, and exploration and exploitation of petroleum and natural gas fields), nuclear fission and nuclear fusion, hydrogen economy, solar energy and geothermal energy, protection of the environment in the production and consumption of energy, and the development of system models in which the interdependence of the different energy sources and energy techniques as well as their interactions with the society are considered. Aspects related to the financing and organization of the program are discussed.

Краткое описание: Technical and safety aspects of the storage of liquefied natural gas (LNG) in tanks are discussed. The special demands the low storage temperature of LNG (-162°C) makes on the construction of the tanks are mentioned, and the suitability of prestressed concrete for such constructions is outlined. The elasticity module, the pressure strength, the linear coefficient of expansion and the conduction of heat of prestressed concrete appear to be all more favorable under cryogenic circumstances than at normal temperatures. Several designs of LNG tanks utilizing prestressed concrete are sketched and described.

During the last 5 years, the water quality of brooks and canals has improved considerably by the building of a sewage purification plant. Because of the character of most of the industries, their concentration in industrial areas and promotion of the use of natural gas as an energy source, the problem of air pollution is insignificant.

This textbook deals extensively with the laws of subsoil water movement, and explains the fundamentals of the dynamics of petroleum and natural gas. Авторы: Van Uchelen O., Menzel C.
Название: Discoloration of white ceilings: yellow, brown and black discoloration of white ceilings by air pollutants and gas heating (Dutch)
Организации: Veg Gasinst. N.V., Apeldoorn, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Van Uchelen, O., Veg Gasinst. N.V., Apeldoorn, Netherlands; Menzel, C., Veg Gasinst. N.V., Apeldoorn, Netherlands
Краткое описание: A report on the causes of brown discoloration of white ceilings and walls in gas heated rooms is presented. The mechanism of brown discoloration is represented in a scheme indicating the influences of the factors of outside air, mixture of natural gas and air, gas stove, ceiling, chimney, atmospheric dust, ventilation and man. Neither the natural gas nor the type of gas stove appeared to correlate directly to the discoloration. The brown discoloration results from a complicated interaction of a large number of variable factors. The main cause is constituted by the heating and decomposition of atmospheric dust by the gas stove, but compliance with some other conditions, particularly the occurrence of condensation processes, is required. Proper ventilation can prevent the discoloration.

Авторы: Walter B., Bastgen D., Pantenburg H., Koch W.
Название: Effects of gas and deicing salts on soil and plants [EINWIRKUNGEN VON GAS UND AUFTAUSALZEN AUF BODEN UND PFLANZE]
Авторы организаций: Walter, B.; Bastgen, D.; Pantenburg, H.; Koch, W.
Краткое описание: A report is presented on investigations of soil samples in the city of Trier, GFR, in order to find the causes of large scale occurrence of death and disease among street trees and plants in private front gardens. These examinations included determinations of the pH value, phosphoric acid available to the plants, potash, magnesium, boron, salt content, percentage of sodium and chlorine of the salt content, carbon content, and active manganese and bivalent iron. It was found that in comparison with control soil samples some typical chemical changes had taken place in soils of damaged trees. These changes could be traced back to leakages in gas pipes due to changeover from coal gas to natural gas. The leakage of gas into the soil leads to reductive processes which can be easily demonstrated by determining manganese and bivalent iron in the soil. The plant damage is not caused by the natural gas, but by the oxygen deficiency arising in the soil. In some soils, deicing salts were established to constitute an additional source of plant damage. Possibilities of correcting the damage are described.

Краткое описание: The sources of contamination of foodstuffs by the heavy metals, lead, mercury and cadmium in the German Democratic Republic are mentioned, and the possible health risks of these contaminations are discussed. The main sources of lead contamination are brown coal combustion and the increasing motor traffic consumption of gasoline containing lead, whereas direct or indirect contamination of foodstuffs by mercury mainly originates from waste waters from chemical and woodworking industries, seedcorn disinfectants containing mercury, and combustion of brown coal, pit coal, natural gas and petroleum. Industrial and agrochemical sources are the main contributors of foodstuff contamination by cadmium.

Краткое описание: On the basis of graphs and tables, the author analyzes the development of the Dutch energy consumption and the percentages of pit coal, natural gas and the various petroleum products since 1967, and examines how this development relates to SO2 emissions and what role was played by the oil crisis at the end of 1973. Since 1967, the percentage of natural gas in the total energy consumption steadily rose while the percentages of petroleum and pit coal declined. Among the petroleum products, the consumption of fuel oil is decreasing, whereas naphta consumption shows a spectacular rise. Analyzing the effects of the oil crisis and the Arab oil boycott of the Netherlands, the author concludes that the supplies of both crude oil and refined products during that period were above normal levels. The SO2 emissions in the Netherlands considerably decreased since 1967, mainly as a result of the decrease in the consumption of fuels containing sulfur.

Авторы: Sachse J., Jaskulla N.
Название: Gas as an environmentally unobjectionable fuel for internal combustion engines [GAS - EIN UMWELTFREUNDLICHER KRAFTSTOFF FUR VERBRENNUNGSMOTOREN]
Авторы организаций: Sachse, J.; Jaskulla, N.
Краткое описание: Possibilities and advantages of the use of liquafied petroleum gas (LPG) as fuel for internal combustion engines are discussed. The technical advantages of LPG operation over petrol operation are the regular mixture distribution, a lower soecific fuel consumption, little formation of combustion residues, and a better ignitability of the mixture. On the other hand, LPG operation brings more expenses for the fuel supply systems and effects a decrease of power of up to 25%. The exhaust gases of LPG engines contain no lead compounds, sulphur oxides or soot, and less CO, hydrocarbons and nitrogen oxides than the exhaust gases of petrol engines. The changes of emissions of harmful substances resulting from conversion of the Otto carburettor engine or the diesel engine to LPG natural gas, or combined LPG and diesel fuel operation are diagramed, and the future possibilities of application of LPG operation in motor vehicle traffic are discussed.

Авторы: Demaret D., Fialaire J.
Название: Hydrogen sulfide poisoning in a natural gas refinery [LES INTOXICATIONS PAR L'HYDROGENE SULFURE DANS UNE RAFFINERIE DE GAZ NATUREL]
Авторы организаций: Demaret, D.; Fialaire, J.
Краткое описание: From their 14 yr experience the authors describe 130 cases of H2S poisoning plus one poisoning incident involving 85 employees. The importance of the risk in a refinery of natural gas with a high H2S (14.5%) content is stressed. Various types of poisoning were observed, generally acute but also subacute forms. Poisoning could be mild, moderate or severe. First aid on the site of the accident, first care at the Medical Center of the works, immediate consequences and sequelae and the importance of preventive measures (individual protective masks, rapid intervention by the rescue staff) are described. It is concluded that a good prognosis can be achieved in most cases.

Название: Conversion of cattle feedlot wastes to ammonia synthesis gas
Организации: Dept. Chem. Engin., Texas Tech. Univ., Lubbock, Tex. 79409, United States
Авторы организаций: Halligan, J.E., Dept. Chem. Engin., Texas Tech. Univ., Lubbock, Tex. 79409, United States; Herzog, K.L., Dept. Chem. Engin., Texas Tech. Univ., Lubbock, Tex. 79409, United States; Parker, H.W., Dept. Chem. Engin., Texas Tech. Univ., Lubbock, Tex. 79409, United States; Sweazy, R.M., Dept. Chem. Engin., Texas Tech. Univ., Lubbock, Tex. 79409, United States
Краткое описание: A study was undertaken to determine the potential of a process to convert cattle feedlot manure into anhydrous ammonia. Due to the fact that ammonia is currently produced on a large scale using natural gas and air, only the processing associated with a reactor system to convert the manure into a suitable synthesis gas was considered in this study. The synthesis gas can be further processed to anhydrous ammonia using existing technology. During this phase of the project, a 4.1 cm diameter fluidized-bed reactor system was designed, constructed, and operated. Significant yields of synthesis gas were obtained when this system was fed a mixture of manure, air, steam, and a very small stream of carbon dioxide. This synthesis gas was deemed to be compatible with existing ammonia plant technology and suitable for subsequent conversion to anhydrous ammonia. The upper limit of the production rate of this gas was not determined in this study; however, the ammonia equivalent of manure was shown to be in excess of one-half metric ton of ammonia per metric ton of dry, ash-free animal waste. Assuming that on an as-is basis the manure contained 15% moisture and 25% ash, this would translate to approximately 317 kg of ammonia per metric ton of manure received.

Краткое описание: A comparison is made of the NO equilibrium concentrations in the primary zone for diesel oil and natural gas operation. The NO//x emissions in a gas turbine system, which is suited for both fuels, measured by a titration method, show that the NO//x decrease through the use of high Btu gas can also be achieved through lean gas. The increased CO emission has little effect on the air hygienic value.Evaluation of the measurements of NO(x) in gas turbines driven with low octane gas shows that nitrogen component does not increase NO(x) and that the concentrations are not less than with high octane gas. The low emission of NO(x) from high octane gas, 50% as compared with diesel, is also reached with low octane gas. The 4 to 5 times higher emission of CO makes little difference to the level of air hygiene.

Краткое описание: A discussion is presented on the compatibility of a secured and economical energy supply and effective environmental control, particularly in the state of Baden Wuerttemberg, Federal Republic of Germany. Several alternatives to the use of oil for electricity generation in power plants are discussed, including mineral coal, natural gas, nuclear energy, tidal energy, nuclear fusion, geothermal energy, wind energy, solar energy, and glacier power plants. Nuclear energy is concluded to be the most attractive energy source from the point of view of economy and security of the energy supply. The discussion of environmental problems related to power plants, particularly nuclear power plants, comprises pollution of the atmosphere by harmful gases and radioactive substances, dangers arising from possible disturbances in nuclear power plants or hydraulic power stations with large dams, influences of the climate by the introduction of large amounts of heat and moisture in the air via cooling towers, decrease of river water quality in the case of river water cooling, and disfigurement of the landscape by cooling towers, chimneys, clouds of smoke or fog, and high voltage lines.

Авторы: Noirfalise A., Bonnet F., Foidart G., Olivier R., Lamy M.
Название: Poisoning cases admitted into the University Hospital of Liege in 1971 [LES CAS D'INTOXICATIONS ADMIS A L'HOPITAL UNIVERSITAIRE DE LIEGE EN 1971]
Организации: Lab. Toxicol. Clin. Med. Leg., Univ. Liege, Belgium
Авторы организаций: Noirfalise, A., Lab. Toxicol. Clin. Med. Leg., Univ. Liege, Belgium; Bonnet, F., Lab. Toxicol. Clin. Med. Leg., Univ. Liege, Belgium; Foidart, G., Lab. Toxicol. Clin. Med. Leg., Univ. Liege, Belgium; Olivier, R.; Lamy, M.
Краткое описание: During the past 10 yr, the number of cases of poisoning admitted to the University Hospital, Liege, increased more rapidly than that of all other cases admitted. In 1971, the number of poisoning cases admitted amounted to 9.7% of cases admitted to the Medical, Anesthesiological and Pediatric Departments, equivalent to 4.3% of all admissions to the hospital. A survey revelaed that medicines represented the main cause of acute posioning encountered and that of these the most frequently used were the barbiturates, which also caused the most serious toxic effects. It was found that the benzodiazepines and the non barbiturate hypnotic agents most often caused poisoning of reduced seriousness; this fact is of importance to general practitioners obliged to prescribe a particular drug from a large choice of sedatives and hypnotics. Carbon monoxide poisoning is still a problem despite the fairly widespread replacement of coal gas by natural gas, and in this regard bathrooms are particularly dangerous. Voluntary poisoning (suicide attempts) by children are at present very common, and poisoning accidents in children are in many cases more serious than they were 10 yr ago. It is the authors' opinion that campaigns to make the public aware of the problem have up to now had very little effect.

Краткое описание: The transportation of LNG (liquefied natural gas) in rivergoing tankers and barges, particularly on the Rhine, appears to be technically feasible nowadays and as far as the costs are concerned it is also probably an economic preposition. It should, however, be pointed out that assessments have been based purely on costs and on an assumption of a relatively large number of operational days per year (continuous utilization of tanker capacity). In practice, therefore, more thorough criteria will have to be applied to the computation of freight rates and larger margins may have to be allowed for to cover the risks involved. Nevertheless, the basic precondition for the use of rivergoing LNG tankers is the delivery of sufficiently large quantities of liquefied natural gas to the Rhine estuary and a continuous turnover (consumption) for the gas at its final destination. It cannot yet be predicted whether or not LNG chains will be set up with Rotterdam, for example, as the receiving terminal. But the obvious possibility of transporting larger quantities of LNG on inland waterways independently of transmission pipelines may contribute towards a future situation in which an optimum cost LNG chain is routed via a terminal in the Rhine delta.

Адрес для корреспонденции: Germany

Авторы: Falkenberry H.L.
Название: Emission controls status at coal burning power plants
Авторы организаций: Falkenberry, H.L.
Краткое описание: As natural gas and oil become even less plentiful and more expensive, coal will have to become the basic source for more and more of the energy needs in the United States. Nuclear power is assuming an increasing share of the electric power generating load, but the use of coal for electric power generation is still expected to increase further, and to remain a major factor in the generation of electric power for many years to come. However, the use of coal as a power plant fuel presents serious problems in meeting environmental standards. Various techniques for emission control in coal burning power plants, including methods of particulate, SO2 and nitrogen oxides removal from stack gases, are examined in this article. Cost considerations, regulatory deadline and control equipment installation problems are also reported.

Название: Air pollution. 19. Control techniques for hydrocarbon and organic solvent emissions from stationary sources
Краткое описание: Hydrocarbons (HC) and organic solvents found in ambient air originate from both stationary and mobile sources. In 1970, an estimated 31.7 Gkg of hydrocarbons were emitted in the United States. Of the sources surveyed, motor vehicles were the largest single emitters of HC, accounting for 17.7 Gkg, or 56% of the total. Industrial process losses were the next largest source, accounting for 5.0 Gkg. Other sources, such as forest fires, organic solvent evaporation, fuel combustion in stationary sources, and disposal of solid wastes accounted for the remaining emissions. Hydrocarbons are emitted for the exhaust, crankcase, and from evaporation losses. An estimated 17.7 Gkg of hydrocarbons were emitted by gasoline and diesel power vehicles in 1970. All gasoline powered motor vehicles accounted for approximately 99%, while automobiles accounted for 74% of the total. Urban driving represented about 50% of the total travel; however, almost 59% of the HC emissions took place in the urban areas. HC emissions from stationary combustion sources were an estimated 0.54 Gkg per year in 1970. Half of this total is estimated to arise from the use of natural gas, while the balance comes predominantly from coal and fuel oil. Kerosene and wood are minor sources making up the combined total.

Название: Air pollution. 13. Control techniques for particulate air pollutants
Краткое описание: Particulate material found in ambient air originates from both stationary and mobile sources. Of the 23.8 Gkg of particulate pollution produced by industrial, commercial, and domestic sources in 1970, 12.1 Gkg were emitted from industrial sources, including industrial fuel burning; 11.0 Gkg from power generation, incineration, and space heating; and 0.7 Gkg from mobile sources. For each 4.55 m3 of fuel consumed, diesel fueled engines produce about 5.9 kg of particulate matter; gasoline fueled engines produce about 3.9 kg. Gasoline engine produced particulate matter emanates from the crankcase and exhaust gases. It consists of carbon, metallic ash, aerosol hydrocarbons, and metallic particles. The particulate matter emitted from a diesel engine consists of carbon and hydrocarbon aerosols. About 95% of the total energy in the United States is supplied by fossil fuels. In 1969, coal supplied about 21% of the energy; petroleum, about 40%; and natural gas, about 36%. Particulate emissions from these sources were about 8.1 Gkg in 1968, but were reduced to about 6.1 Gkg in 1970. Industrial processes, including industrial fuel burning, discharged an estimated 12.1 Gkg of particulate materials in 1970.

Краткое описание: Sulfur oxides (SO2 and SO3) found in ambient air originate from both stationary and mobile sources. The term SO(x) is used herein to indicate the sulfur oxides singly or as mixtures. Of the 30.94 Gkg of sulfur oxides produced by industrial, commercial, and domestic sources in 1970, 20.2 Gkg were emitted from coal combustion, 3.8 Gkg from fuel oil combustion, 7.6 Gkg from industrial processes, and the balance primarily from waste disposal and transportation. Electrical utilities accounted for about 17.6 Gkg, or 73% of the total originating from stationary sources. Other industrial sources that emit relatively small quantities include glass manufacture, corn starch production, sugar refining, and sulfur fusion processes.

Авторы: Bobrova L.A., Svinukhov A.G., Sabitova V.F., Nurulina S.Z.
Название: Purification of process gas from sulfur compounds
Авторы организаций: Bobrova, L.A.; Svinukhov, A.G.; Sabitova, V.F.; Nurulina, S.Z.
Краткое описание: For obtaining ammonia, based on conversion of hydrocarbon raw material, the purification of natural gas from sulfur compounds is usually performed by a combined method including hydrogenation and hydrolysis of organic compounds of sulfur to hydrogen sulfide over a catalyst 481-Cu and purification from H2S by means of an adsorber based on zinc oxide (481-Zn). The authors studied the hydrodynamics of the sulfur purification process and the effects of the concentrations of sulfur components in process gas on the adsorptive capacity of contact masses 481-Cu and 481-Zn and the volume of the latter with respect to sulfur. The tests were conducted on natural gas from the Bukhara deposit, with the addition of different gases from the commercial installations of the Salavat Petroleum Plant. It was shown by tests that a large part of the hydrogen sulfide contained in the starting process gas is adsorbed in the converter by the 481-Cu catalyst. Sulfurization of the contact mass seems to take place in the converter along with hydrogenation of organosulfur.

Авторы: [автор не найден]
Название: Possibilities for conservation of energy in the Netherlands [MOGELIJKHEDEN TOT ENERGIEBESPARING IN NEDERLAND]
Краткое описание: An interim report on the first two chapters of a study on the possibilities of saving energy in The Netherlands is presented. The study is being conducted by 5 experts and carried out by working groups concerned with transport, heat, electricity, industry, environment, and social and economic aspects. The study covers the period up to 1985, and is intended to indicate what existing technology could be applied to saving energy, based on the expectation of considerably rising energy prices in the coming years. The main conclusions from the first chapter are that the world petroleum supplies are being consumed at a higher rate than is considered desirable; all possibilities for replacement of petroleum and natural gas have only minor significance in influencing the energy situation up to 1985; developments in the world petroleum supply will be of great importance to the Dutch energy economy; each possibility of meeting the future world energy requirements will make an excessive demand on available capital; and a study on energy saving in The Netherlands should be especially directed to domestic and agricultural sectors, transport, generation and consumption of electricity, and the industrial sector in general. The second chapter of the study consists of 2 parts: a more detailed reproduction of the factors that played a part in the increase of Dutch energy consumption during the period from 1960 to 1972; and an estimation of the evolution of the Dutch rate of energy consumption until 1985.

Авторы: Brasser L.J.
Название: Air pollution: a global survey of the field of study [LUCHTVERONTREINIGING: EEN GLOBAAL OVERZICHT VAN HET STUDIEGEBIED]
Организации: Inst. Gezondh. Techn. TNO, Delft, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Brasser, L.J., Inst. Gezondh. Techn. TNO, Delft, Netherlands
Краткое описание: Air pollution is defined as any substance in the air which has a negative or damaging effect on human wellbeing. It is not a new problem: historical examples are cited from as early as 1257. Sources of pollution fall into two classes, human and nonhuman. The latter consist of dust, sea salt, volcanic ash, etc. Air pollution of human origin is further divided into radioactive and 'normal'. The sources of the latter are: home heating, public utilities, industry, motor vehicles, and agriculture. These are discussed in order. Home heating is generally done by means of fossil fuels, which, especially if burning is not complete, can be highly polluting. The use of natural gas, a much cleaner fuel, is on the increase. Public utilities include electrical generating stations, garbage incinerators, etc. NO and NO2 are characteristic pollutants from installations of this type. Industrial sources vary too widely for easy summary. Motor vehicles are heavy polluters, especially those using the gasoline engine, which is highly inefficient. Laws are being introduced requiring antipollution devices on automobiles; however, the effect of these devices is to raise burning temperatures in the engine, thus producing greater amounts of NO and NO2. In The Netherlands, greenhouse heating forms a significant source of pollution. Reactions between pollutants occur in the atmosphere; for instance, that between hydrocarbons and nitrous oxide, which results in substances which irritate mucous membranes and damage plants. Dispersion of atmospheric pollution is not yet completely understood, but is in general influenced by temperature lapse rate. Apart from accidents releasing poisonous gases into the air, the day to day effects of heavy air pollution are very detrimental, including increased chances of lung cancer. Also, pollutants which settle on grass may be eaten by grazing animals and thus arrive in the food chain. In measuring pollution, it is not the average level that is important, but rather the intensity of the peaks, and their duration. In conclusion, the legal situation in The Netherlands is summarized, with emphasis on the provisions of the 1972 Air Pollution Law.

Авторы: Hoeks J.
Название: Influence of leakage of natural gas on reduction processes and accumulation of organic matter in soil [INVLOED VAN AARDGASLEKKAGE OP REDUCTIEPROCESSEN EN ACCUMULATIE VAN ORGANISCHE STOF IN DE BODEM]
Организации: Inst. Cultuurtechn. Waterhuishoud., Wageningen, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Hoeks, J., Inst. Cultuurtechn. Waterhuishoud., Wageningen, Netherlands
Краткое описание: Injury to the root system of trees by natural gas is a serious problem in the Netherlands. It is estimated that from 60 to 90 per cent of the total annual tree deaths are caused by leakage of natural gas from the older gas mains. Although natural gas itself is non toxic, its presence creates highly unfavourable conditions in the root zone. In the direct vicinity of the leak a completely anaerobic zone is formed because of the combined effect of displacement of oxygen by natural gas and especially consumption of oxygen by microbial activity. Methane is oxidized by bacteria in the methane oxidation zone, where methane meets oxygen from the surrounding normal soil. An appreciable amount or organic matter is accumulated in the vicinity of the leak because of the accumulation of bacterial cells. The accumulation of organic matter and the extent of the anaerobic zone depend on the exchange of gases between soil and atmosphere. Under pavements the exchange is restricted, so less oxygen is available for microbial oxidation of the gas. This in turn increases the region where gas is found and reduces the rate of methane oxidation and consequently the accumulation of organic matter per unit volume of soil. Reduction processes occur near the leak after the onset of anaerobic conditions. The redox potential decreases, so nitrates, manganese, iron and sulfate may be reduced causing a shift in pH. In acid soils the reduction of iron is dominating resulting in a rise in pH. The increase in pH near a leak is shown. In alkali soils a decrease in pH is usually observed because the CO2 carbonate equilibrium is dominating. The soil will be reaerated after repair of the leak. Consequently the reduced components are oxidized and the redox potential increases. These oxidation processes and the microbial decomposition of the accumulated organic matter require much oxygen. It is shown that the rate of oxygen consumption in a gassed soil is much higher than the oxygen consumption rate in the corresponding normal soil. The hatched area in this figure represents the total amount of oxygen required for oxidation and decomposition of the accumulated substances. It is called the oxygen overdemand P(o) of the gassed soil. Obviously the oxygen overdemand of a gassed soil depends on the amount of organic matter accumulated. The oxygen consumption rate was found to decrease exponentially with time. As soon as the oxygen concentration has increased to an acceptable level, replanting of trees may be performed at leakage sites. Laboratory experiments proved that, except for the aeration status, no other undesirable aftereffects of leakage occur at least in sandy soils. The growth of beans was even better in gassed soil because of a higher soil nitrogen content. Probably atmospheric nitrogen has been fixed by nitrogen fixing bacteria (e.g. anaerobic Clostridium spp.) during the gas leakage.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Latta B.F.
Название: Subsurface disposal of waste in Kansas
Организации: Kansas State Dept. Hlth, Topeka, Kans., United States
Авторы организаций: Latta, B.F., Kansas State Dept. Hlth, Topeka, Kans., United States
Краткое описание: The use of wells for the subsurface disposal of wastes has been practiced in Kansas since 1935. All of the early waste disposal wells were used to dispose of oil field brine. Permits for the first industrial waste disposal wells other than oil field wells were issued in 1952. Two state agencies have jurisdiction over the subsurface disposal of oil field wastes in Kansas. Before using a well for the subsurface disposal of oil field or gas field brines, the operator must submit plans and specifications for each disposal well to the Kansas State Corporation Commission. These must be approved by both the State Corporation Commission and the Kansas State Department of Health. The Corporation Commission, through its Oil and Gas Conservation Division, determines that the use of the proposed well will not result in loss or waste of gas or petroleum resources. The Department of Health, through its Oil Field and Subsurface Disposal unit, Division of Environmental Health, determines that use of the proposed well will not result in pollution to the water resources of the state. Before using a well for the subsurface disposal of industrial wastes other than oil field or gas field wastes, an application must be filed with, and a permit issued by, the Kansas State Department of Health. The maximum wellhead pressure that may be used to inject wastes into both classes of wells must be approved by the Department of Health. At present, there are 3,200 approved oil field and gas field saltwater disposal wells in use, receiving a total of about 3.5 million bbl of salt water per day. Not included are 2,550 saltwater repressuring systems in the state which consist of from one to several hundred injection wells. The depths of the oil and gas field disposal wells range from less than 500 ft to about 6,000 ft. Thirty eight zones ranging in age from Late Permian to Precambrian are being used. About 60% of the wells inject wastes into limestone or dolomitic rocks and 25% into sandstones. Lithology of other disposal formations is sandy or gypsiferous shale, salt, anhydrite, conglomerate, and 'granite wash.' Injection pressures being used range from gravity at the wellhead to 0.5 psi/ft of depth to the injection zone. There are 30 industrial waste disposal wells (other than oil or gasfield wells) at 20 plants in the state which include 10 LPG undergroundstorage projects, two salt companies, two petroleum refineries, four natural gas compressor stations, one chemical manufacturing plant, and one fertilizer plant. Most industrial waste being disposed of in the subsurface consists of salt brine, which is introduced into Arbuckle rocks at depths ranging from about 3,000 to 6,000 ft. All wells are constructed so as to preclude any hazard to fresh water. The Department of Health's present policy concerning industrial wastes is that only those wastes that cannot be treated and disposed of by other practical methods will be considered for disposal in the subsurface. Experience with both industrial and oil field disposal wells shows that most operational problems are caused by selection of an injection zone with inadequate permeability, lack of preliminary waste treatment or inadequate treatment, or failure to provide an effective maintenance program.

Авторы: Peters W., Lemke K., Juntgen H.
Название: Low emission combustion of pit coal [EMISSIONSARME VERBRENNUNG VON STEINKOHLE]
Организации: Proceedings of the third International Clean Air Congress, Germany
Авторы организаций: Peters, W., Proceedings of the third International Clean Air Congress, Germany; Lemke, K., Proceedings of the third International Clean Air Congress, Germany; Juntgen, H., Proceedings of the third International Clean Air Congress, Germany
Краткое описание: A survey is given of research and development work of the West German Coal Mining Union on pit coal desulfurization, adsorptive flue gas desulfurization, and pit coal gasification as methods for low emission combustion of pit coal. In desulfurization of pit coal, only pyritic sulfur can be removed. An examination of the composition of 27 fine grained coal samples showed that on average 39% of the total sulfur content can be separated by coal preparation. In the flue gas desulfurization, the SO2 in the flue gas is bound to a carbon containing adsorbent and converted into sulfuric acid at temperatures between 100 and 140° C. The regeneration of the adsorbent yields sulfur as the end product. Besides SO2, the adsorbent also binds nitrogen oxides and fine dust. The coal gasification is exemplified by the conversion of coal into a natural gas substitute with the help of waste heat from a high temperature nuclear reactor as heat of reaction. In this process, one ton of coal yields 860 m3 CH4 and only 350 m3 CO2.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Hunigen E., Sachse J., Jaskulla N.
Название: Atmospheric hygienic evaluation of exhaust discharges from motor vehicles as a basis for establishing maximal permissible levels [LUFTHYGIENISCHE BEWERTUNG VON KRAFTFAHRZEUG EMISSIONEN ALS EINE GRUNDLAGE DER GRENZWERTFESTLEGUNG]
Организации: Proceedings of the 3rd International Clean Air Congress
Авторы организаций: Hunigen, E., Proceedings of the 3rd International Clean Air Congress; Sachse, J., Proceedings of the 3rd International Clean Air Congress; Jaskulla, N., Proceedings of the 3rd International Clean Air Congress
Краткое описание: Three parameters for the hygienic evaluation of emissions from motor vehicles and judgement of the effectiveness of emission lowering measures are defined and discussed. The parameter 'atmospheric hygienic importance' of a harmful substance represents the role of the substance concerned in the total toxicity of the emissions during a typical driving cycle. The 'atmospheric hygienic effectiveness' of an emission lowering measure is defined as increasing with a decrease in the sum of the ratios of the discharged quantity to the maximum permissible level in the air for the individual exhaust gas components after execution of the measure. This effectiveness is diagrammed for a number of measures on the Otto carburetor engine (such as use of fuel free of catalyst and lead, controlled mixture preheating and petrol injection in the induction pipe), changeover from the Otto carburetor engine to other types of engines (such as the steam engine, Stirling engine and liquid gas engine), and changeover from the diesel engine to a natural gas engine. The 'toxicity parameter' for the exhaust gas from motor vehicles is defined as the sum of the ratios of the emission (expressed in g/km for passenger cars and g per kWhr power for trucks) to the maximal permissible level for the individual exhaust gas components.

Авторы: Rayzacher B.
Название: Living environment, industry and government [HET LEEFMILIEU, INDUSTRIE EN OVERHEID]
Организации: Stichting Concawe, Den Haag, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Rayzacher, B., Stichting Concawe, Den Haag, Netherlands
Краткое описание: An introductory table indicates world energy use from 1955 to 1985; a second table breaks down energy sources by percent for the same time period. Far less energy will be obtained from coal and wood in the future, slightly more from natural gas, much more from petroleum, and somewhat more from water, nuclear, and geothermal sources, and petroleum will remain the major source of energy for the next 15 to 20 years. Technological developments to limit the damage which petroleum production causes to the environment are discussed. There are dangers to water sources associated with the pumping of petroleum from the ground, and there are possibilities of marine pollution through the activities of ocean tankers, although these have been largely reduced by the oil companies themselves. Older refineries are important sources of water pollution but newer facilities contain significant improvements. Sulfur content of petroleum is also a problem, leading to serious air pollution. Technical solutions to these problems within industries are not sufficient, and a firm stand on the part of government must be taken.

Авторы: Heap M., Lowes T., Walmsley R.
Название: Emission control from fossil fuel fired boilers and furnaces: The potential of burner design - PROCEEDINGS PROCEEINGS OF THE THIRD INTERNATIONAL CLEAN AIR CONGRESS
Организации: IFRF, Ijmuiden, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Heap, M., IFRF, Ijmuiden, Netherlands; Lowes, T., IFRF, Ijmuiden, Netherlands; Walmsley, R., IFRF, Ijmuiden, Netherlands
Краткое описание: This paper reports some of the work being carried out at the IJmuiden Research Station of the I.F.R.F. to reduce pollutant emissions from stationary combustion sources. The work described is directly concerned with NO(x) emissions from a large steam raising plant. The research program at IJmuiden is planned to enable burners to be designed for minimum pollutant emissions and yet maintain desirable combustion characteristics. Parametric studies are described which have been carried out to establish the effect of various burner design parameters on NO(x) formation in large scale natural gas and pulverized coal flames. These studies have enabled generalized burner design criteria to be formulated for minimum emission of NO(x). The potential of burner design optimization to control NO emissions from natural gas and pulverized coal is clearly demonstrated. However, it must be remembered that burners must be designed to satisfy several requirements. Research investigations are continuing which will enable all burner requirements to be satisfied with minimum pollutant emissions.The paper reports results of the investigations conducted in order to explore a method for reduction of pollutant emissions from stationary combustion sources. The research was directed toward design of burners for minimum pollutant emissions. This paper describes parametric studies which have been carried out to establish the effect of various burner design parameters on NO//x formation in large scale natural gas and pulverized coal flames. These studies have enabled generalized burner design criteria to be formulated for minimum emission of NO//x.
Ключевые слова указателя: Gas burners; Furnaces, Space heating; environmental health

Авторы: Pershing D.W., Brown J.W., Berkau E.E.
Название: Relationship of burner design to the control of NO(x) emissions through combustion modification
Организации: US Environm. Protect. Agency, Off. Res. Developm., Contr. Syst. Lab., Nat. Environm. Res. Cent., Research Triangle Park, N.C. 27711, United States
Авторы организаций: Pershing, D.W., US Environm. Protect. Agency, Off. Res. Developm., Contr. Syst. Lab., Nat. Environm. Res. Cent., Research Triangle Park, N.C. 27711, United States; Brown, J.W., US Environm. Protect. Agency, Off. Res. Developm., Contr. Syst. Lab., Nat. Environm. Res. Cent., Research Triangle Park, N.C. 27711, United States; Berkau, E.E., US Environm. Protect. Agency, Off. Res. Developm., Contr. Syst. Lab., Nat. Environm. Res. Cent., Research Triangle Park, N.C. 27711, United States
Краткое описание: The combustion of propane, distillate oil, a 0.3% nitrogen oil, and pulverized bituminous coal was examined in a versatile laboratory furnace. In each case testing was conducted to determine the relationship of burner (and process) parameters to the control of NO(x) emissions. The results show that in general propane and distillate oil give about the same NO(x), the 0.3% N oil about twice the NO(x), and coal at least 2 1/2 times as much. Increased burner throat velocity and flue gas recirculation were shown to be extremely effective in reducing thermal NO(x), but neither worked very satisfactorily with the high nitrogen oil or coal. Increasing air preheat substantially increased the NO(x) emissions from propane and distillate oil and caused lesser increases with the high nitrogen distillate and pulverized coal. Future work will extend the program to natural gas and No. 6 oil and will consider two stage combustion. This paper summarizes results obtained under ROAP 21ADG Task 42 (in house) under the sponsorship of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.

Авторы: Booth L.A., Balcomb J.D.
Название: Nuclear heat and hydrogen in future energy utilization
Авторы организаций: Booth, L.A.; Balcomb, J.D.
Краткое описание: Future demand for the world's supply of carbon based fuels will eventually deplete this supply to the point at which their use becomes economically infeasible. Hydrogen, which is virtually inexhaustible in the form of water, could be substituted for natural gas and petroleum based fuels for industrial and residential heating and for transportation. Nuclear energy, either fusion or fission, would be the primary energy source. Thermal energy from the nuclear heat source would be converted to electric energy in a conventional heat engine cycle. Hydrogen could be produced from water by a cyclic thermochemical process. Gaseous hydrogen for industrial and residential heat would be transported in a high pressure pipeline system. Liquid hydrogen or hydrogen stored in metal hydrides could be used for transportation fuels. Energy complexes of two types would form the basis of this future energy economy: Large plants, located offshore would produce hydrogen and electricity with desalted water as a byproduct; and smaller plants, located inland near urban centers, would produce primarily electricity and hydrogen.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Raines G.E.
Название: Environmental impact assessment of nuclear power generation facilities: a case example
Организации: Battelle's Columbus Lab., Columbus, Ohio, United States
Авторы организаций: Raines, G.E., Battelle's Columbus Lab., Columbus, Ohio, United States
Краткое описание: A procedure for environmental impact assessment has been developed at Batelle's Columbus Laboratories and has been utilized in the areas of nuclear power and substitute natural gas manufacture. The methodology presented in this report is a second generation effort developed as an extension of work performed on the environmental impact evaluation of Indian Point 2, a new Consolidated Edison facility on the Hudson River. Indian Point 2 is a 873 MWe pressurized water reactor.The procedure for environmental impact assessment is to perform a ″total″ benefit-cost analysis for the planned installation. This analysis must consider the environmental, social, and economic effects, and attention should be directed toward obtaining a balance among these effects by considering: alternative basic processes, alternative sites, construction impact, operational impact and process modifications to reduce impact. The evaluation of environmental impact, which is more local in scope, is structured around a matrix approach in which the effects of plant operation on the surrounding environmental conditions and components tabulated in a systematic manner. The numerical values for insertion in the matrix are obtained by developing weighted value functions for each category. Illustrative results will be presented for the anticipated operational environmental impact analysis of the Indian Point-2 (IP-2) nuclear power plant, a new Consolidated Edison facility on the Hudson River.
Ключевые слова указателя: Nuclear power plants; Environmental engineering; environmental health
Адрес для корреспонденции: Raines, Gilbert E.

Авторы: Mullan J.W.
Название: Reduction of sulfur oxide emissions by fuel modifications
Авторы организаций: Mullan, J.W.
Краткое описание: In this article, the author discusses the various forms of sulfur in coal, reviews the removal of sulfur from coal prior to combustion, and briefly discusses conversion of coal to gas. Of the cleaning processes discussed in this paper, none results in total removal of sulfur. Mechanical and chemical methods of cleaning coal will, at best, result in only partial removal of pyritic sulfur; itself only a fraction of the total sulfur in coal. In view of the recent forecasts of the potential cost of removing sulfur from flue gases or during combustion, elaborate cleaning or treating methods prior to combustion have little economic potential in the electric power industry except in the case of some established plants where addition of stack devices may not be feasible. Generally, coal preparation prior to combustion would make sense only where the application of a relatively simple and inexpensive method of cleaning would remove sufficient sulfur from the coal to make it an acceptable power plant fuel under terms of local restrictions. Coal gasification does offer the future fuel user a 'clean fuel' - no SO2 and particulates, and reduced nitrogen oxides. However, the future of coal gasification appears to lie in providing, not a replacement for natural gas, but a supplement, as the cost of finding and using natural gas reserves increases. As a long range supplementary source of low sulfur fuel, this method has promise for the future.
Ключевые слова указателя: environmental health

Авторы: Quillman B., Vogelsang C.W.
Название: Control of particulate and SO2 emissions from an industrial boiler plant
Авторы организаций: Quillman, B.; Vogelsang, C.W.
Краткое описание: Sulfur dioxide control cost parameters are evaluated for wet scrubbers, electrostatic precipitators and bag filters, based on fuel costs, availability and technical risk factors. Although tail-end gas scrubbing, using limestone as the alkali to control both SO//2 and particulates yielded the highest potential for annual operating cost reductions and would enable use of highly available 3. 0% S coal, system reliability has not been demonstrated. The preferred alternatives are natural gas or, when not available, No. 2 oil until flue gas scrubbing proves practical.Determination of the most economical route to control industrial boiler plant particulate and SO2 emissions for a specific site requires an in depth analysis of the factors applicable to that site. The major factors are fuel cost and availability, how they are expected to vary with time, the confidence in the forecast, and the relative technical risk of pollution control alternative selection. In view of this and the unproven state of flue gas scrubbing technology, this evaluation has resulted in the following conclusions for the specific site, based on many judgment factors as well as economic evaluations. Natural gas and No. 2 oil when gas is not available is the preferred route so long as current price and availability forecasts hold. The most economic alternative on a cash flow basis to natural and No. 2 oil is 0.7% S coal using either bag filters or electrostatic precipitators. However, this is valid only if the fuel price differential between low and high sulfur coal holds as forecast. Further, SO2 control is entirely dependent upon an assumed 10 yr supply of 0.7% S coal. Tail end limestone flue gas scrubbing offers the greatest potential on an annual operating cost basis. However, investment is high and risk is great as system reliability has not been demonstrated. This should be the preferred route because it makes possible the use of our most abundant fuel resource. However, more demonstration of technology is required before the investment risk is reasonable. As a result of this study, the following program has been adopted at the site involved to prepare for the time when natural gas is not an available boiler fuel. Continue with natural gas and No. 2 oil as long as possible. Maintain an ongoing program to determine if flue gas scrubbing is practical. Stay intimately familiar with all changes in fuel prices and availability.

Авторы: Adamse A.D., Hoeks J., de Bont J.A.M., van Kessel J.F.
Название: Microbial activities in soil near natural gas leaks
Организации: Laboratory of Microbiology, Agricultural University, Wageningen, Netherlands; Institute for Land and Water Management Research, Staringgebouw, Wageningen, Netherlands
Авторы организаций: Adamse, A.D., Laboratory of Microbiology, Agricultural University, Wageningen, Netherlands; Hoeks, J., Laboratory of Microbiology, Agricultural University, Wageningen, Netherlands, Institute for Land and Water Management Research, Staringgebouw, Wageningen, Netherlands; de Bont, J.A.M., Laboratory of Microbiology, Agricultural University, Wageningen, Netherlands; van Kessel, J.F., Laboratory of Microbiology, Agricultural University, Wageningen, Netherlands
Краткое описание: From the present experiments it may be concluded that in the surroundings of natural gas leaks, methane, ethane and possibly some other components of the natural gas are oxidized by microbial activities as long as oxygen is available. This is demonstrated by an increased oxygen consumption and carbon dioxide production, as well as by increased numbers of different types of bacteria. The resulting deficiency of oxygen, the excess of carbon dioxide, and perhaps the formation of inhibitory amounts of ethylene, are considered to be mainly responsible for the death of trees near natural gas leaks. Also the long period of time needed by the soil to recover, may be due to prolonged microbial activities, as well as to the presence of e. g. ethylene. The present experiments suggest that especially methane-oxidizing bacteria of the Methylosinus trichosporium type were present in predominating numbers and consequently have mainly been responsible for the increased oxygen consumption. However, some fungi oxidizing components of natural gas, including methane and ethane may also have contributed to the increased microbial activities in the soil. The same will be true of a possible secondary microflora on products derived from microorganisms oxidizing natural gas components. © 1972 Springer-Verlag.
