Авторы: Burgess D., Biordi J., Murphy J.
Название: Hazards of spillage of LNG into water
Организации: US Dept. Interior, Bur. Mines, Pittsburgh, Pa., United States
Авторы организаций: Burgess, D., US Dept. Interior, Bur. Mines, Pittsburgh, Pa., United States; Biordi, J., US Dept. Interior, Bur. Mines, Pittsburgh, Pa., United States; Murphy, J., US Dept. Interior, Bur. Mines, Pittsburgh, Pa., United States
Краткое описание: This report provides the results of a supporting investigation for the U.S. Coast Guard extending from January 15, 1971 to January 14, 1972. The program was a follow up of an earlier (1969) study for the Coast Guard in which the spillage of LNG into water produced unexpected vapor explosions. The two main objectives of the present study were to assess the hazards of vapor explosions, and to repeat on larger scale the earlier observations of atmospheric dispersion of the natural gas downwind of a spill. Approximately 12,000 gallons of LNG were used in the various tests; this LNG came from two domestic sources: one in which heavy hydrocarbons were present in very low concentration and which vaporized quietly; one in which the ratio ethane/heavier hydrocarbons was about 10/1 and which provided numerous delayed vapor explosions. No explosion was obtained which duplicated the 1969 experience. The program did not reveal the mechanism of vapor explosions. This failure was mitigated by ingenious advances elsewhere. The program did show that explosions under various experimental conditions did not ignite the flammable vapor cloud and that the energy release is very modest relative to chemical explosions.

Авторы: [автор не найден]
Название: Synthane coal gasification pilot plant to demonstrate feasibility of converting coal to substitute natural gas
Краткое описание: The final Environmental Impact Statement of the Department of the Interior, Bureau of Mines, on the proposed construction and operation of a large pilot plant at a Bureau research facility near Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, for the operation of a coal gasification process, known as the Synthane Process, for the conversion of coal to sulfur free substitute natural gas (SNG) is presented. The construction and operation of the proposed plant would accumulate information to evaluate the overall feasibility of a commercial plant producing SNG and would be designed to identify associated environmental problems and study control measures as necessary. Estimated duration of the project is 5 yr, including plant construction operation. Among the aspects of environmental impact considered in this report are: probable environmental impact of the proposed action, provisions to mitigate adverse environmental effects, probable adverse effects that cannot be avoided should the proposal be implemented, irreversible and irretrievable commitment of resources that would be involved, alternatives to the proposed action, consultation and coordination in developing the proposal, and comments from respondents.

Авторы: Jacobs D.G., Struxness E.G., Kelly M.J., Bowman C.R.
Название: Consideration of the radiological impact from the hypothetical use of contaminated natural gas from nuclearly stimulated reservoirs
Организации: Health Physics Division, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, El Paso, TX, United States; Reactor Chemistry Division, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, El Paso, TX, United States; El Paso Natural Gas Company, El Paso, TX, United States
Авторы организаций: Jacobs, D.G., Health Physics Division, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, El Paso, TX, United States; Struxness, E.G., Health Physics Division, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, El Paso, TX, United States; Kelly, M.J., Reactor Chemistry Division, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, El Paso, TX, United States; Bowman, C.R., El Paso Natural Gas Company, El Paso, TX, United States
Краткое описание: Commercial utilization of nuclear engineering in underground applications, such as stimulation of a gas reservoir, may result in detectable quantities of residual radionuclides becoming a part of the distributed product. The concentration of radionuclides is small, but their existence implies that sizable population groups could be exposed. It is prudent to consider the radiation exposures before they occur and, unless they arc clearly insignificant, balance them against the benefit the population would derive from this application of Plowshare technology. The concentrations of tritium and 85Kr at the beginning of production testing were about 700 and 110 pCi/cm3, respectively, and the concentration has decreased exponentially with the quantity of gas removed from the well. Traces of37A and39A, fission product rare gases, and low concentrations of14C(5700 yr half-life) were the only other radionuclides reported to be present in the gas. None of the gas removed from the well has actually entered the production system, but an assessment has been made of the radiation doses to consumers and workers by considering the hypothetical introduction of Gasbuggy gas into the actual gas collection and processing system during production testing. Workers at the Blanco gas processing plant could potentially receive a dose-equivalent to the gonads of 0.3 mrem during the processing of Gasbuggy Gas and could receive as much as 1.3 mrems if gas processed through the plant were used for home heating with non-vented heaters. Both estimates arc for dose received during the lifetime of the well although most of this dose would be received during the first year of gas production. The potential contribution of tritium and85Kr to the general (atmospheric) background has also been considered in areas consuming large quantities of gas, but this is small relative to the potential dose to the individual occupying a space heated home where the combustion products arc not vented properly. © 1972 Health Physics Society.

Авторы: Shields C.E.
Название: Elevated Carbon Monoxide Levels from Smoking in Blood Donors
Организации: Blood Transfusion Division, U S Army Medical Research Laboratory, Fort Knox, Kentucky, United States
Авторы организаций: Shields, C.E., Blood Transfusion Division, U S Army Medical Research Laboratory, Fort Knox, Kentucky, United States
Краткое описание: The greater affinity of hemoglobin for carbon monoxide than for oxygen can lead to increased carboxyhemoglobin in blood donors who smoke. The presence of carboxyhemoglobin has an adverse effect on the oxygen dissociation curve resulting in a decreased release of oxygen to the tissues. When this is present, along with the progressive decrease in oxygen‐carrying capacity resulting from storage, bank blood will have an even greater loss in ability to provide oxygen to the tissues of a recipient. Carbon monoxide can be displaced from hemoglobin by oxygen when there is room air exchange by donor respiration. The rate of this exchange can be accelerated by taking advantage of the natural gas laws and using a higher concentration of oxygen for respiration or by increasing ventilatory exchange. Volunteers in the present study raised their carboxyhemoglobin levels by heavy smoking and had the rate of decrease in carboxyhemoglobin tested either after breathing pure oxygen or after exercise‐induced hyperventilation. The decreases in carboxyhemoglobin levels were accelerated by either method. Donors who had not smoked showed low carboxyhemoglobin levels which did not decrease after exercise. Thus, blood banks could minimize carboxyhemoglobin levels in collected blood by restricting the smoking of donors, by not collecting blood for at least 2 to 4 hours after smoking, or by using oxygen breathing or exercise‐induced hyperventilation to accelerate the donors excretion of carbon monoxide. 1971 AABB

Авторы: van Mourik J.H.C.
Название: The formation of nitrous fumes in gas flames
Организации: Medical Department, N. V. Philips Gloeilampenfabrieken, Eindhoven, United Kingdom
Авторы организаций: van Mourik, J.H.C., Medical Department, N. V. Philips Gloeilampenfabrieken, Eindhoven, United Kingdom
Краткое описание: When a mixture of gas and air is burned, only small quantities of nitrous oxides are formed. if extra oxygen is supplied, the production of NO increase rapidly. The change-over from coke oven gas to natural gas in the Netherlands was accompanied by a considerable increase of the nitrous oxides concentration in spaces where gas flames are used, and especially so in glass blowing shops. The main cause is due to a different flame characteristic, so that one is inclined to add too much oxygen to a natural flame, involving a corresponding increase of the concentration of nitrous vapours, even far exceeding the permissible concentration. A better air ventilation or exhaust system for the working place is then called for. © 1967 The British Occupational Hygiene Society.
